title: Create OO integration admin user in the suite IdM on OpenShift
content:
This topic contains instructions on how to integrate OO with the IdM service of the suite.

You'll use the information obtained from Generate sensitive data for OO in the following steps.

Create the OO Containerized integration admin user

The OO Containerized integration admin user is responsible for performing integration between OO and IdM. OO uses the credential of the OO integration admin user to synchronize groups and roles from IdM to OO.

You can create the OO integration admin user in the suite IdM portal by following the instructions below:

  1. Log in to the suite IdM (https://<External_Access_Host>/idm-admin) with a suite-admin account

  2. Navigate to the SYSBO IDM organization, and then click it.

  3. Go to Users in the navigation pane, and click     on the toolbar. The ADD USER page opens.

  4. Create the OO IdM integration admin user using the following values and then click SAVE.

    Field (*required) Description
    Name * Name of the new user. To avoid confusion later, enter the user name as oo-integration-admin. 
    Display Name * Display name of the new user. Use oo-integration-admin in this case.
    Password * Specifies a password for the OO integration admin user.
    Type * Select SYSTEM.
    Password Policy Leave the field empty.
    User Attributes Leave empty.
  5. Click SAVE. When selecting type SYSTEM, if a user isn't assigned a password policy, a "defaultFor=SYSTEM" password policy gets applied on clicking SAVE.

Associate integration admin user to the administrators group

  1. In the suite IdM (https://<External_Access_Host>/idm-admin), access the SYSBO organization.

  2. Go to Groups in the navigation pane, click the administrators group, and then click    in the toolbar. The Group Settings page opens.

  3. Scroll down to the Users section, for the Associated Users field, search for and click the oo-integration-admin user to associate it to the group. 

  4. Click SAVE. 

You'll use the oo-integration-admin user credentials later.

Obtain the password for the IdM transport user

Run the following commands on the bastion node to obtain the password from the suite's vault for the user idmTransportUser. You'll need to use this user for the integration between OO and IdM.

  • Get the suite namespace: 
    SUITE_NS=$(echo `kubectl get ns | grep itsma | awk '{print $1}'`) && echo $SUITE_NS
  • Get suite's IdM pod name: 
    SUITE_IDM_POD=$(echo `kubectl get pods -n $SUITE_NS | grep -m1 idm- | head -1 | awk '{print $1}'`) && echo $SUITE_IDM_POD
  • Get the password for suite's IdM user idmTransportUser: 
    TRANSPORT_PASS=$(kubectl exec -it $SUITE_IDM_POD -n $SUITE_NS -c idm -- bash -c "/bin/get_secret idm_transport_admin_password_secret_key" | awk -F= '{print$2}') && echo $TRANSPORT_PASS
